What's the "best practice" for collecting junit tests and running them 
within an ant build?  I definitely don't want to hand-create a suite, 
and I'd prefer to not have to depend on a naming convention.  Is there 
an easy means to pick up all the tests in a particular source tree?  Or 
compile the test source to a different classes directory and pick up the 
tests there?  What are people using for this?

  - George
